page.title: 02St Peter's Church.
page.content: St Peter's Church was built in the 13th century, and stands at the centre of the old village.It is built of sandstone, and recently much restoration work has been carried out with the help of the Y.T.S. St Peter's Church is a focal point in Barnburgh, and brings many visitors into the village eager to learn of the famous Cat and Man legend associated with it.The church has been responsible for introducing many and varied activities for the two villages. One only has to glance at the Church Magazine to realise just how busy, people,both young and old are. At the side of the Church stands the Parochial Hall which was built in 1912, and where many different associations meet. E.g. Scouts - Cubs Guides - Brownies - Mothers' Union - Fellowship and Bible Study - W.I.
